filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: 每週三來到Fifteen Minutes Cafe 英語咖啡館,喝一杯老師們的本週主題特調,一起探討國際文化、時事質雅、網路和音樂等多元主題、聽眾西州主題相關的詞彙、慣用語和常用例句。
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: A long day! At the time of recording, it's Friday. So, Clem, let's enjoy this Friday, shall we? It's a lovely Friday, we're heading into winter. And at the time of airing this episode, it's Thanksgiving! Yippee! Yay!And talking about Thanksgiving.And talking about Thanksgiving. And what should we do on Thanksgiving, Clem?It must be a big meal, I think.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: A big meal, yeah.Yeah, Thanksgiving to give thanks.Or you can just thank yourself.That's what I'm talking about.Long time ago, Thanksgiving was to celebrate and have a big meal to give thanks for all the harvest.So in Taiwan, we also celebrate harvest time.But in U.S. in northern America and in the west, it's Thanksgiving.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: And when we talk about Thanksgiving, what we see in the movies is a massive turkey, a big, big, big turkey that you roast for one whole day.And then Thanksgiving dinner, your friends and family, everybody come together and carve the turkey.So you have this massive knife and you carve slices of turkey, roasted turkey.Now, in Taiwan, how should we celebrate Thanksgiving?You can also eat roasted turkey if you like.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: I've never seen any roasted turkey restaurants.But we do have turkey restaurants, don't we?Yeah, we do have turkey restaurants.But talking about Taiwan's turkey meal, the famous one, the most famous one is chai turkey rice, my hometown.Turkey rice, chai turkey rice, chai turkey rice.That's how you should actually celebrate Thanksgiving in Taiwan.That's what I think.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: When in Rome, do as Romans do.So in U.S., you go eat turkey, a massive turkey carved up.In Taiwan, you go to Jiayi and you eat turkey rice.And we can eat turkey rice all day, 24 hours.24 hours.Oh, seriously, it's true.In Jiayi, there are so many turkey rice restaurants that's open early in the morning and open for lunch, open for dinner and open for midnight snacks.Yeah.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: So when you go to Jiayi, you eat, eat, eat, eat, eat, eat all day long.But now we have to talk about turkey rice because the western turkey is a roasted turkey.But what about the Taiwanese turkey?Is it roasted?Is it cooked?Is it steamed?Is it braised?Is it fried?What is it?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: So how's Jiayi turkey rice done?It's done by steaming, right?Steamed.Steamed or boiled.Steamed or boiled.And the result is a chewy, tender turkey meat.And now how do we cut it?We don't slice it into massive slices.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: It's not carved.It's shredded from turkey breast or cut into cubes.And if you get slice, then it's turkey thigh.I think I've had slight turkey thigh meat because they're kind of long and they stay on your rice.Clem, tell me, when I have turkey rice, there's that special smell.Where does that smell come from?The aroma.You know, it's not turkey meat smell.It's more like there's some turkey oil or maybe garlic.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: Or sauce.What exactly is it?Especially sauce.The sauce, many way to make the sauce.But the most important thing is garlic, shallots and the turkey oil is important too.I know there are different recipes in Jiayi.And what are the main difference in the recipes?Depending on each restaurant's secret recipe, the sauce can feature a combination of
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: chicken broth, lard and soy sauce.Yummy.If we hear chicken broth, lard and soy sauce.I think chicken broth referring to turkey broth, right?Maybe it's turkey, maybe it's chicken.Lard, that means oil and soy sauce.Very, very nice.So that's the secret recipe.What about other restaurant?How do they change the recipe?Some places may skip the crispy shallots altogether and instead add
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: a slice of bright yellow pickled radish or a bit of pickled vegetables like cucumber salad.I've seen cucumber salad.So the one I had at the night market, they had turkey strips, sliced strips.And I think that could be from turkey thigh.And then I also saw cucumber salad.I'm not a big cucumber guy, so I didn't really eat it.But I'm a yellow pickled radish guy.If I see yellow pickled radish, I would eat that cucumber salad.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: But I hear sometimes they also have a secret Jiayi mayonnaise.Some restaurants will have secret Jiayi mayonnaise and it looks kind of transparent.It's not exactly white white milky colored mayonnaise.It's like a salad dressing that you can spread on toast or sandwiches.That's the Jiayi way too.You add some of that salad dressing.We can add the salad dressing.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: Not only the turkey rice, but everything.On everything?Seriously?Yeah.Oh, okay.You can heard about Liang mian ba wan.No way.No way.So maybe I should try those recipes next time.You know, adding the Jiayi mayonnaise on everything and see how it works.So what is like a full house Jiayi turkey rice?You know, is there more to just turkey on rice?Other than mayonnaise, a perfectly fried egg.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: It's cooked until fragrant.It's also a perfect match of turkey rice.So try breaking the yolk and mixing it with the sauce.You'll love it.Wow, that sounds like a full house turkey on rice.So other than turkey rice and the turkey oil or the lard, you can add a fried egg.That is amazing.And you want the egg yolk, a little soft fried egg.So you can break the yolk and mix it with all the sauces.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: That sounds like a big feast.Clem, tell us, Jiayi people, can they eat turkey on rice for breakfast?For breakfast, for lunch, for dinner.Any time we can eat the turkey rice.So that's what people do.And you grew up like that.So sometimes you wake up and you're like, oh, I want turkey rice.And your mom will say, oh, no problem.Here's turkey rice.And lunch after school, you go and find your perfect turkey rice restaurant and then you go and have it.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: You go and have turkey rice dinner.And that's the Jiayi way.You have turkey rice all the time.Now my next question is, how come Jiayi has turkey and we don't have turkey in Taipei?What happened there?In fact, Taiwan began raising turkeys during the Japanese colonial period.But initially, they were not bred for consumption.They were kept as pets.Okay, pets in the Japanese colonial era.Interesting.In the 80s,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: as the United pressure Taiwan to open this market to American products, turkeys were no exception.So a large number of American turkeys were imported into Taiwan, leading to the rise of the turkey farming industry.Wow, that's interesting.So we had to open and turkey came.Obviously, after the 80s and the 90s, we also got Subway.So for those of you who don't know, and I'm a big Subway fan because I eat a lot of
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: Subway because when I don't know what to eat, I go to Subway and buy me a sandwich.Subway does not sell chicken sandwich.Subway sells turkey sandwich.The white meat that they sell is turkey because turkey meat is lean.There is less fat in turkey.And of course, in terms of cost effectiveness, maybe for Subway, it's cheaper for Subway to offer turkey in the West.But in Taiwan, we love chicken more than turkey.But in Jiayi,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: it's turkey.So when turkeys see Jiayi people, they have to run.Yeah.Run, turkey, run, because Jiayi people will turn you into great night market food.That's the beginning of the turkey farming industry.And then how did it get to Jiayi?Well, according to the elders, there was already a tradition in the South of eating shredded chicken with bright sauce over rice.But because turkey was more affordable and had more meat,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: so we use turkey to replace it.Ah.Originally, it was chicken with bright sauce on rice.And then when turkey came, it's like, oh, turkey is cheaper.Great.Replace it with turkey.Yeah.More meat in turkey.More meat.So let's have turkey.Okay.Great.But does that mean Jiayi turkey rice is a big bowl of rice?Not really.Or is it a very small bowl of rice with a lot of turkey meat on it?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: I think it's a small bowl.But have more turkey on top.I see.Rice also gets expensive sometimes.So turkey is more affordable, more turkey on rice.Maybe double turkey on single portion of rice.Very, very nice.Now, that's the turkey history.For you, Clem, you have so many recipes, Jiayi recipes of turkey rice.Okay.Your favorite way of eating.Do you have a secret recipe that you would add
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: or you would do to your turkey rice?Because every restaurant has a different recipe, right?But you must have your secret way of doing it.Well, yeah, I think I prefer sweet sauce.Okay.So what if you faced a Jiayi turkey rice that's more salty?How do you make it more sweet?Make it more sweet, then we'll have mayonnaise.So can you go to like a restaurant and then you think, oh, the flavor is a little too salty.Here, you know, in my bag, I've got Jiayi
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: mayonnaise and you take it out and you add it on your turkey rice.Do you do that?No, we can order the side dishes and they'll have mayonnaise.So you order the turkey side dish and you ask for mayonnaise?Yeah.And then you add it on your rice?Right.That's very smart.Then you don't upset the restaurant, right?Because they will ask like, hey, why don't you like my recipe?So Clem, what I find interesting is affordability is the key when it comes to Turkey, right?Jiayi people
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: started the farming because it's affordable.And then in the West, actually in Thanksgiving, although it's to thank great harvests for the pilgrims, it's the pilgrim's way of giving thanks and celebrating harvest.But it was also Turkey because Turkey is a lot bigger in size and can feed more people.Chicken is too small.So if you want to celebrate a day on Thanksgiving or whichever festivities,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: you need one chicken per person.Whereas if you have one massive turkey, it feeds the whole family.So Turkey was in terms of affordability and the size was much better as a party meat.So which is interesting because in Taiwan, it was more affordable for chicken turned into Turkey.And in the U.S., the original, not that they really like Turkey, but it was much bigger.So there's some similarity here, you know, for people when they see
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: a big bird and it's meaty bird, it's a good bird.Meaty bird is a good bird.Meaty bird is a good bird.And so if we dig into the little history, 1600s pilgrims and Native Americans, they feast at the harvest.And that's how they celebrated.And then the Americans came and they saw this happening.They saw this festivities.So they caught on trend.Then they also celebrated this harvest festival.So in Taiwan, do we have
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: a turkey rice day?No, but I think we should have it.I think we should have one because like you said, jai people eat turkey on rice for breakfast, for lunch, for dinner.But there's no day that celebrates Turkey's affordability and big meat is good meat, right?Big bird is good bird.So we need a big bird day or a turkey rice day.We all know Thanksgiving in the U.S. is a national holiday on the 4th,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: Thursday in November.So maybe in Taiwan in the future, the 4th, Thursday in November, we should call it jai turkey day or we can call it the big bird day or turkey rice day.We don't have to have jai in it, but it could be a Taiwan thing, right?Taiwan turkey rice day.And that's how we celebrate it.And we celebrate it by celebrating Turkey's big meat affordability and the fact that it can feed the family good food.And then, of course, you can have side dishes.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: We can have pickled cucumber salad or we can have jai mayonnaise or we can have any type of salad dressing that you like.We can create all sorts of recipes, not only available to jai, but also Taipei, Yilan, Kaohsiung.Everybody can have turkey on this day.Fourth Thursday in November.That's maybe something we can propose to the president.We should email him.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: We should email him.We should email him.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: So you prefer sweet sauce.So the sauce is more salty in Taipei.And what about the mayo?Do they have the mayo for you?No.Okay.So you have to bring your own mayo.Technically, this comfort food for you growing up in jai is not available in Taipei.Does that mean every time you go back to jai, you have turkey rice?Yeah.When I go back to jai, I'll have turkey rice almost every time.Almost every time, and you make sure you have more than enough turkey rice,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 英語咖啡館 Ep.245_ 吃貨學英語- 台式感恩節問嘉義人就對了 Give thanks by having a bite of Chiayi.json

chunks.chunk_text: 你回来的话,台北没有鸡鸡饭。

chunks.chunk_text: 让我们知道在下面用留言的链接。今天就这样,如果你们想要鸡鸡饭日,就像我们这样,也请留言,我们会签订署,我们会去签署,然后我们会写信给总统,让我们看看我们能不能去台湾鸡鸡饭日。

chunks.chunk_text: 给我们所有的开心和美味的台湾饭食物。包括泡泡茶,炸鱼鸡饭,臭豆腐,所有的美式食物。所以,Clem,这一季,你应该去尝试我们所有的开心食物。所以,明年你可以和我们分享,好吗?
